info.title: CloudTalk API
info.description:
# Introduction
Welcome to CloudTalk API reference! Many of these businesses use the CloudTalk API to automate and enhance their customer support with CloudTalk Support. With CloudTalk we are re-building telco industry from the ground and taking it to the next level with first-class customer support system. Please find below the full documenation to CloudTalk.

# API Overview

The API is organized around the following resources:

API Area | Description
----------------|-------------
Calls | Browse your call history, download recordings and access all your calls data.
Contacts | Create and update Contacts. Use filters to get lists of Contacts, or access their profiles individually.
Numbers | Automate Numbers modifications. List all your numbers.
Agents | Create or update your Agents, access their settings.
Conversation Intelligence | Get Conversation Intelligence data about your calls.
VoiceAgent | Initiate VoiceAgent calls


[JSON](http://www.json.org/) is returned in all responses. XML is not supported.

The API also uses common approaches for the following:

Function | Description
----------------|-------------
Data | API data is JSON encoded with UTF-8. API JSON is either a single object or a list of objects.
Errors | 4xx and 5xx responses returning JSON with error codes
Rate Limiting | Controls how many requests can be made in a time window
HTTP | Methods are used in accordance with HTTP (GET POST and DELETE are the primary methods used) and resources are identified using URIs. All API requests are sent over HTTPS.


## Authentication

This is an HTTPS-only API. Authentication is based on API Access Key ID and Access Key Secret. The API Access Key ID and Access Key Secret is passed via HTTP Basic Authentication.

 Basic Auth credentials are used to determine on which project should this request be executed on. List of all Basic Auth credentials for the project can be found by Administrators in the Cloudtalk Dashboard Account → Settings → API keys tab.

To try the API via curl on the command-line, the general form used would be:
```
curl -u ACCESS_KEY_ID:ACCESS_KEY_SECRET API_URL
```

For instance, you would execute:
```
curl -u ABCDEFGHIJTESTKEY1:X05Dg4c331c3h61An https://my.cloudtalk.io/api/calls/index.json
```

## Usage

The API may rate limit submission of requests for your application. Such limits are managed as an allowed number of operations per time window, where an operation might be read or an update. In that case a **'429 Too Many Requests'** response code will be returned along with the following headers -

Header name | Description
----------------|-------------
X-CloudTalkAPI-Limit | Maximum number of API requests allowed in the current time window.
X-CloudTalkAPI-Remaining | Number of API requests left in the current window.
X-CloudTalkAPI-ResetTime | Time when rate limit window will be reset as a Unix timestamp.

Note that the default rate limit is **60 operations per minute per company**. If you need to make more requests, please contact our support with detailed explanation of your use case.

## Response Envelopes

**Note:** Conversation Intelligence doesn't follow envelopes.

The API returns one of three envelopes depending upon the request issued:

1. Single Item Envelope
2. Collections Envelope
3. Error Envelope

### Single Item Envelope

All dates/times are returned in ISO8601 format and in UTC timezone.

```
Status: 200 OK
{
    "responseData": {
        "id": 123,
        ...
        "created": "2018-01-10 12:34:56"
    }
}
```

### Collections Envelope

All dates/times are returned in ISO8601 format and in UTC timezone.

```
Status: 200 OK
{
    "responseData": {
        "itemsCount": 65,
        "pageCount": 3,
        "pageNumber": 1,
        "limit": 30,
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 123,
                ...
                "created": "2018-01-10 12:34:56"
            },
            {
                "id": 456,
                ...
                "created": "2017-10-19 09:21:29"
            },
            ...
        ]
    }
}
```

### Error Envelope

```
Status: 404 Not Found
{
    "responseData": {
        "status": 404,
        "message": "Not Found"
    }
}
```

## Encoding

Data is encoded as defined by JSON in [RFC4627](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4627.txt). The default encoding for APIs is UTF-8.

Some query parameters may need to be [url encoded](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Percent-encoding) when sending - for example, the email parameter value used to query users should be encoded.

## Use of HTTP

Request methods are used in accordance with HTTP -

- `GET` is used to access resources and perform queries. The API does not allow modifications (creates, updates, deletes) to occur via GET.
- `PUT` is used to create resources.
- `POST` is used to update resources. PATCH is not currently used by the API.
- `DELETE` is used to delete resources.

Responses use standard HTTP codes. Where there are client or server errors, a list of of one or more errors in JSON format is returned in the body.

The `Accept` header must be used by a client used to indicate a preferred response for `GET/HEAD` requests. Requests without an `Accept` header of `application/json` may be rejected with a client error of 404 or 406. The `Content-Type` header should be used by clients to indicate the submitted format for `POST/PUT` requests.

post.description: Max 10 actions are available in one request. Only sent parameters/values will be updated. If you want to clear the value, just set empty string for that attribute. After sending empty string for properties of `ContactNumber`, `ContactEmail`, `ContactsTag` or `ContactAttribute` all data from these properties will be cleared. When you send values for properties of `ContactNumber`, `ContactEmail`, `ContactsTag` or `ContactAttribute` only these data will be updated, all other will be cleared.

post.description: Make a call using to any phone numbers. To place a new outbound call, make an HTTP POST request. At first it will initiate a call to an agent. Maximum waiting time for an agent to pick up the call is 20 seconds. After an agent picks up, we will automatically call desired phone number.

agent_id.description: Agent ID which will make the call.

callee_number.description: The phone number that will receive this Call. Phone numbers must be in E.164 format (e.g., +442012345678).

end.description: End time of the segment in seconds

segments.text: Hello, I would like to ask for help.

ratio.description: Talk to listen ratio of the caller in percentage

actionItems.description: Specific tasks assigned during the call

decisionsMade.description: Important decisions agreed upon during the call

openQuestions.description: Questions that need to be addressed after the call

risksAndIssues.description: Identify potential risks or issues discussed during the call

customerFeedback.description: Highlight feedback from customers that can inform product development or service improvement

risksAndIssues: Concern about the cost of the services

CallDetailsNote.description: Significant updates discussed during the call

callDateTime.description: Date and time of the call

participants.description: Name, position and company of participants of the call

callMetadata.description: Metadata such as location, reservation number, etc

ImportantDatesAndDeadlinesNotes.description: Capture significant dates mentioned, with clickable links to add them directly to the calendar

dateMention.description: Date and time of the event

end.description: End time of the span in seconds

start.description: Start time of the span in seconds

spans.text: Let's start the discussion in this group.

id.description: Caller ID if exists in the system

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return

call_uuid.description: unique id of the active call

icon_url.description: Url path to the cue card icon

ContentHTML.description: The value as typed in html text editor

value.description: The value as typed in Rich text editor

billsec.description: Duration of the call in seconds

public_external.description: The number of the caller in E.164 format

public_internal.description: The internal number of agent in E.164 format

fax_email.description: If present, call was made to fax using this email

redirected_from.description: If the call was redirected, here is the number from which it was redirected

transferred_from.description: Where did the call was transferred from?

user_id.description: Agent ID assigned to this call

talking_time.description: Duration of the connection between agent and customer

started_at.description: Date and time when the call started

answered_at.description: Date and time when the call was answered

ended_at.description: Date and time when the call finished

waiting_time.description: Duration before connection between agent and customer

recording_link.description: Link to the call detail with recording

daily_price_limit.description: Daily price limit for all calls in EUR. Usually allowed values are from 1 to 200 EUR. Leave empty for using default value.

is_daily_limit_ok.description: Is daily price limit OK? If not, agent cannot make new calls

status_outbound.description: Does agent have outbound calls allowed?

availability_status.description: Current availability status of the agent

extension.description: Extension of an agent. Extension must be four digits long and be unique across whole company.

default_number.description: Default outbound number in E164 format

associated_numbers.description: array of e164 numbers that the agent has assigned

default_outbound_number.description: Default outbound number in E164 format
Default outbound number in E164 format

caller_id_e164.description: Full number in international E.164 format

connected_to.description: Routing type. Where is the number connected. `0 = 'group'`, `1 = 'agent'`, `2 = 'conference room'`, `3 = 'fax'`

source_id.description: Source ID of where is the number located, e.g. Agent ID, Group ID...

external_system.description: Name of external service. Name will be shown to agents while working with contacts.

key.description: Custom field key (max 255 chars per attribute)

value.description: Custom field value (max 255 chars per attribute)

ExternalUrlArray.description: List of all URLs which points to a detail page of a contact in an external service, e.g. CRMs, Helpdesk or any other custom service you use. You may list up to 3 URLs.

name.description: Name of external service. Name will be shown to agents while working with contacts.

public_number.description: Full number in international E.164 format
Full number in international E.164 format

ContactsTag.description: Tags for contact - can include multiple

ContactAttribute.description: Attributes for contact - can include multiple

activity_author.description: Author of activity - user name you want to show

external_id.description: Activity ID from external resource - e.g. your order ID

external_url.description: External url which can be opened from activity detail

activity_date.description: Activity date and time. Set to current company time by default.

CallTag.description: Tags assigned to this call - can include multiple

type.description: Type of person who added the rating

rating.description: Rating value 1 to 5 (from worst to best)

recipient.description: Recipient number in E.164 format. To send Whatsapp message include prefix "whatsapp:+421..." to both sender and recipient numbers.

sender.description: Sender number in E.164 format. To send Whatsapp message include prefix "whatsapp:+421..." to both sender and recipient numbers.

images_by_url.description: Image to be send as MMS. Will be downloaded from URL. MAX 5MB. Can contain up to 5 urls.

images.description: Image sent as blob to be send as MMS. MAX 5MB. Can contain up to 5 images.

file_by_url.description: File to be send to Whatsapp. Will be downloaded from URL. MAX 16MB. To send Whatsapp message recipient and sender number must contain prefix "whatsapp:" example "whatsapp:+421...". Field message must be empty.

file.description: File sent as blob to be send to Whatsapp. MAX 16MB. To send Whatsapp message recipient and sender number must contain prefix "whatsapp:" example "whatsapp:+421...". Field message must be empty.

answer_wait_time.description: Maximum number of seconds we will wait for the call to be answered.

after_call_dialing_auto.description: Automatically dial next contact after a call ends true/false

data.description: Available only in add actions or invalid action data. More data explaining the error or id of new entity.

itemsCount.description: number of resources in the response

limit.description: number of objects sent per page

total_time.description: Total time spent in a call

ringing_time.description: Time spent ringing on an agent

waiting_time.description: Time from after leaving IVR to getting answered/missed by agent

holding_time.description: Time spent on hold during a call

id.description: ID of a call that resolved this call

date.description: Date when the call was resolved

id.description: ID of an agent that resolved this call

name.description: Name of an agent that resolved this call

date.description: Date when the agent answered/missed the call

call_id.description: ID of a call that was answered/missed by an agent

group_ids.description: IDs of groups that the agent belongs to

status.description: Status of the agent call step

reason.description: Reason why agent missed the call

resolved_by.description: ID of a call that resolved this call

date.description: Date when the call was calling the queue

status.description: Status of the queue call step

reason.description: Reason why the queue missed the call

resolved_by.description: ID of a call that resolved this call

date.description: Date when the call was on the IVR step
Date when the call was on the playback step
Date when the call was on the transfer step

status.description: Status of the transfer call step

number.description: Phone number of an internal number

recorded.description: Indicates if the call was recorded

out_of_office.description: Indicates if the call was made in the out of office hours

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Max. number of items in response data.

paginationLimit.name: limit
paginationLimit.description: Maximum number of items to return

paginationOffset.name: offset
paginationOffset.description: Offset the list of returned items by this amount
